instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Intermittent green light on charger (randomly come on) with fan spin for a few seconds then off.
Since then, no green light.
Swapped DC in board and LIO cable, no change

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 8.19 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.43
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>: 0V

<CHIP>U7501</CHIP>:
4: 0
12:0
21:0


So no enables on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.
I though it was the DC in board but the connectors look good.
No corrosion
No water damage.

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
2: 14.10
14: 3.42

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 8.19 V "
SMC doesn't talk with <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> firsy...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 0V

Checked at:

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>:
PIN 5: 0 V ---> PIN5 does not look good
1: 3.42

<RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>: 96 kO
1: 3.42 V
2: 0 V

Worth replacing <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> as a try or is this the SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and see if reset goes high.
If yes, replace the chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
OK replaced <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> now: 3.40

no green light or fan and of course <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is now..... 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Why "of course"???
What you did there?
Post diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 15, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: .142 V

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

1: 13.77-13.99V
2: 13.10-13.75V bouncing
3: 0
4: 3.33
9: 0.03
12: 3.43
13: 3.39
15: 0.047
19: 5.08
20: 5.07
27: 0

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
pin 3 is 0, should be 3.2
pin 3 is short to ground in diode mode.

<RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>: 93K
<RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR>: 1.6 ohm  ---->  should be 46K and I checked multiple times, the resistor looks good


resistance
27-28: 20.5
17-18: 3.5

Pin 3 <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> short in diode mode, replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"Pin 3 <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> short in diode mode, replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>? "
Why so fast?
Remove <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> first; if still short, replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Thanks!!

<CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> removed. Still short on pin 3 <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Replaced <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR>

It worked.

Green light, fan spin.
Boots into OSX

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
i removed it, i put a new one back
Do I not have to do that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Why to replace, if was good?
No need to put back original.
Just try to work in a logic manner (for the future)...
